column4: i got a problem with Mozilla Firefox Browser.... Can anyone help with the sudo comand to install it.....
just download the binary tarball unpack it in your /home/username/Documents directory  then just creat a link from your taskbar or desktop to /home/username/Documents/firefox/firefox
you dont have to install firefox to use it
what doesnt display text
goto the mozilla home page and download the firefox  tar.gz  file
you may want to delete/rename  the /home/username/.mozilla/  directory then run firefox again
What do u mean run again? like opening the firefox again?
ok  raname the /home/username/./mozilla  directory   /home/username/./mozilla-old
then try running firefox again
its a hidden directory
so your file manager wont show it by default
right click "show hidden files"
mozilla isnt firefox
run firefox
run epiphany
open a terminal and type epiphany
run nautilus then
sounds like you did some serious sytem breaking
did you isntall firefox with apt-get
nooo.... it came with the Ubuntu CD
your problem is your using Linux like Windows, if you do that your going to constantly break it, learn to use the package manager
That may be true........ cause im used to windows
with Ubuntu you dont download "anything" "every", you get the package manager to download an install your software
flush the install start again
